He reigned as the world heavyweight champion from 1937 until his temporary retirement in 1949. Louis has the longest single reign as champion of any boxer in history.

The film highlights his most important fights, including the legendary matches against Max Schmeling, which carried deep political and cultural significance during the 1930s. For many Americans, Louis represented hope and resilience, particularly in the context of the Depression and the looming threat of Nazi Germany.
